  • Using Meteor Beam paired with Power Herb gives Lunala a strong but risky burst option versus Pokemon like Incineroar and Ho-Oh that also increases the damage of its Moongeist Beam. Trick Room serves as a consistent speed control option thanks to Shadow Shield, allowing Lunala and its team to have more favorable matchups into faster-paced team compositions. Expanding Force is another choice when paired with Indeedee-F to deal consistent STAB spread damage, with Moonblast being a solid alternative for extra coverage against opposing Dark-types such as Chien-Pao, Grimmsnarl, and Urshifu-S.
  • The bulk investment allows Lunala to survive Throat Chop from Chien-Pao and Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S with Shadow Shield active. The Speed investment is enough to still function both inside and outside of Trick Room; for example, it outspeeds threats like Rillaboom and maximum Speed Incineroar when Trick Room is not active while getting the jump on Urshifu when Trick Room is active. The remaining EVs are dumped into Special Attack.
  • Tera Water provides a strong neutral typing while also giving it key resistances to powerful Fire- and Ice-type moves such as Koraidon's Tera Fire-boosted Flare Blitz and Calyrex-I's Glacial Lance. Tera Fairy acts as a strong alternative option, turning Lunala's Dark weakness into a resistance and increasing the damage of its Moonblasts, allowing it to pick up OHKOs on Pokemon such as Miraidon and Urshifu-R at +1.

Teambuilding

  • Lunala mainly struggles against Dark- and Normal-type Pokemon like Terapagos, Ursaluna, and Incineroar that Lunala is unable to do reliable damage to if Meteor Beam has already been used. Grimmsnarl can also pose a major threat to Lunala, using Spirit Break and Light Screen to lower Lunala's already non-extraordinary damage while also potentially threatening huge damage if it has Foul Play. Farigiraf is especially an issue for Lunala, being able to tank a Meteor Beam and immune to Moongeist Beam. Farigiraf can also threaten good damage with Foul Play and deny Lunala of its Trick Room with a Trick Room of its own.
  • Fighting-type Pokemon like Koraidon and Urshifu-R that also want a solid bulky partner serve as great teammates to cover for the Dark- and Normal-types that Lunala struggles with. Incineroar also works as a solid partner, providing Fake Out pressure to let Lunala set Trick Room or use Meteor Beam as well as Intimidate complementing Lunala's already superb bulk. Grimmsnarl also makes for a great partner for Lunala; setting up both Light Screen and Reflect to allow Lunala to stick on the field longer and fire off consistent damage with Moongeist Beam.
  • Chi-Yu is another solid pair with Lunala, threatening opposing Ghost-types like Calyrex-S that Lunala could occasionally struggle against while having Beads of Ruin increasing Lunala's overall damage output. Indeedee-F also provides a lot of helpful tools for Lunala in the form of Follow Me, which redirects threatening attacks, and Psychic Terrain, which both blocks important priority moves in Trick Room like Sucker Punch and enables the use of Expanding Force.

Bulky Setup.description:
Set Details

  • Calm Mind Lunala is able to easily set up thanks to Shadow Shield and can just as easily run away with the game. With its naturally good matchups into Zamazenta-C, Calyrex-I, and Iron Hands, Calm Mind Lunala finds itself as a strong piece in the metagame.
  • Moonblast is an amazing coverage move for Lunala, letting it threaten Dark-types that resist Moongeist Beam like Grimmsnarl and Urshifu-S while also providing a way to hit the Ghost-immune Normal-types like Farigiraf.
  • Leftovers grants Lunala passive recovery, letting it slowly patch up its Shadow Shield and making it even harder to take down.
  • The HP EVs are optimized for Leftovers recovery. When combined with the given Defense EVs, Lunala has a very high chance to survive a Tera Water Surging Strikes from Mystic Water Urshifu-R in the rain as well as a Life Orb-boosted Sucker Punch from Chien-Pao. The Special Defense allows Lunala to survive a Life Orb-boosted Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S. An important thing to keep in mind is that all of these are taking Shadow Shield into account, which greatly boosts Lunala's survivability. The Special Attack investment lets Lunala cleanly OHKO non-Focus Sash Chien-Pao with Moonblast.
  • Tera Fairy is a great Tera type for Lunala, letting it resist the STAB moves of Dark-types like Chi-Yu that formerly threatened it. On top of this, Lunala is able to shed its weakness to Ghost-type moves of threats like Flutter Mane, gain an immunity to Draco Meteor from the likes of Miraidon and Raging Bolt, and boost the power of Moonblast, notably OHKOing Miraidon after a Calm Mind.

Teambuilding

  • Since this set doesn't have the space to contain Wide Guard, Calyrex-S becomes a very tough matchup for Lunala, especially when it can use Encore to force Lunala to use Calm Mind over and over again. Lunala can also struggle to take hits from strong physical attackers like Koraidon and Calyrex-I due to its rather mediocre Defense stat.
  • Without Tera Fairy, Dark-types like Urshifu, Incineroar, and Chi-Yu are all still very problematic for Lunala, hitting hard with Wicked Blow, Knock Off, and Dark Pulse, respectively, and not taking much from Lunala's Moongeist Beam in return. Snarl users like Raging Bolt and sometimes Miraidon are also annoying, preventing Lunala from gaining Special Attack boosts from Calm Mind.
  • Miraidon is a good option to partner up with Calm Mind Lunala, nuking any Dark-types with Electro Drift or Dazzling Gleam or neutering strong special attackers like Calyrex-S and opposing Lunala with Snarl. Thanks to Choice Scarf, Miraidon can also easily outspeed opposing Miraidon and Raging Bolt and KO them with Draco Meteor. Koraidon is also able to deal with Dark-types but struggles a bit more into other Restricted Pokemon when Koraidon cannot move before its foes.
  • Rillaboom is a great partner for Lunala, using Fake Out to disrupt foes to let Lunala freely set up and setting up Grassy Terrain, which not only overrides Miraidon's Terrain but also provides Lunala with even more passive recovery. Incineroar can also use Fake Out to support Lunala, with other options like Intimidate and Will-O-Wisp to better disrupt physical attackers.
  • Other forms of damage reduction such as Grimmsnarl's dual screens and Volcarona's Struggle Bug can also help protect Lunala. The same goes for redirection support, with Pokemon like Ogerpon-C and the aforementioned Volcarona providing Lunala with a free turn to use Calm Mind.
  • Incineroar highly benefits Lunala, as it threatens Calyrex-S with Knock Off, punishing it for trying to use Encore into Lunala, while resisting and mitigating the damage of many strong physical attackers, namely Calyrex-I, Chien-Pao, and Rillaboom. In return, Lunala is able to pressure the Fig
  • Wide Guard support from the likes of Zamazenta-C is a great option to keep Lunala safe, notably blocking powerful moves such as Astral Barrage and Glacial Lance from Calyrex-S and Calyrex-I, respectively.

Rillaboom.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Rillaboom can be used with basically anything, as a lot of Pokemon appreciate its supportive toolkit. However, the Pokemon that Rillaboom synergizes the most with are, as stated before, setup Pokemon. Setup Pokemon appreciate Fake Out and Grassy Terrain from Rillaboom; the former gives them space to set up, while the latter offers residual healing, increasing their survivability. Rillaboom also appreciates partners that can help against Fire-types, such as Incineroar, and Steel-types, such as Archaludon and Kingambit.
  • Primarina and Sneasler are great partners for Rillaboom, as they help with the aforementioned checks, while Rillaboom can help against the Water-types that resist Primarina's Hyper Voice and double Sneasler's Speed by using Grassy Terrain to activate Grassy Seed, triggering Unburden. Kingambit, Gholdengo, and Volcarona are the main setup partners for Rillaboom; Kingambit scares away Incineroar, Gholdengo offers quick setup and spread damage, and Volcarona is able to KO the Grass-types that resist Wood Hammer.
  • Rillaboom's main weakness is its typing. Grass may be good defensively because it lets Rillaboom switch in easily, but it is not great offensively in this metagame, as a plethora of Pokemon resist Wood Hammer such as Amoonguss, Gholdengo, Archaludon, Kingambit, and Incineroar. The main way around this is to utilize Rillaboom's support capabilities when it cannot offer anything offensively in the position and pivot intelligently. Sneasler is another big threat, as it has a faster Fake Out than Rillaboom and can threaten it with Dire Claw. Bulky redirectors, such as Magmar and Electabuzz, can take big hits from Sneasler for Rillaboom. Smart pivoting and chipping Sneasler down throughout the game are how Rillaboom is able to get rid of it.

Strategy Comments

  • Rillaboom's role is as a bulky support Pokemon that can still do great damage. Pivot with U-turn to cycle Fake Out, giving its partner free turns, and, when possible, nuke foes with powerful Wood Hammers and Grassy Glides.
  • Rillaboom is usually a valuable part of the team throughout a game. In the beginning, Rillaboom is able to leverage Fake Out to allow its partner to set up early or get early damage off. Rillaboom usually pivots during the middle of the game to get more use out of Fake Out and get Grassy Terrain back on the field. Rillaboom chips down the opposing team throughout the game, but it excels at cleaning up in endgames thanks to its access to priority moves and high damage output.
  • The biggest checks to Rillaboom are Pokemon that resist Grass. When playing against these Pokemon, it is important to pivot out with U-turn to preserve Rillaboom and allow it to get more value later in the game with its attacks. Additionally, partners such as the aforementioned Sneasler and Primarina can help against these Grass-resistant foes.

Offensive Pivot.description:
• Assault Vest Rillaboom excels at being a bulky pivot that is able to support its team with Fake Out and Grassy Terrain recovery while having high damage output with Wood Hammer. Rillaboom synergizes very well with setup Pokemon that appreciate the free turns that Fake Out provides as well as the healing from Grassy Terrain.
  • Grassy Glide allows Rillaboom to take care of weakened foes, while Wood Hammer compensates for the low power of Grassy Glide to operate as a nuke. U-turn is usually the last move of choice on Rillaboom, as it allows one of its partners to come in safely while chipping down the foe, but Rillaboom can forgo it for High Horsepower, which allows Rillaboom to hit common Steel- and Fire-types such as Kingambit, Gholdengo, and Incineroar.
  • Assault Vest is used on Rillaboom, as it enhances Rillaboom's ability to pivot, with the tradeoff being that it is unable to run status moves such as Protect and Taunt.
  • Tera Fire gives Rillaboom an immunity to Will-O-Wisp and a resistance to common Fire- and Steel-type moves from Pokemon such as Incineroar, Hisuian Typhlosion, and Gholdengo.
  • The Speed investment allows Rillaboom to outspeed maximum Speed Tyranitar and uninvested Annihilape, while the Attack investment allows Rillaboom to OHKO both Ursaluna formes with Wood Hammer. The bulk allows Rillaboom to live Flare Blitz from Incineroar, two Ice Beams from Porygon2, and a +1 Fiery Dance from Volcarona.
  • Assault Vest Rillaboom is able to function a lot more effectively as a bulky pivot, as it is able to switch into special moves more easily. This is particularly helpful against teams that are more offensive in nature, such as hard Trick Room teams and Tailwind hyper offense teams that usually use strong specially offensive Pokemon such as Gholdengo and Hatterene to break through teams.

Offensive Nuke.description:
• Miracle Seed Rillaboom is an offensive piece that can still support its team with Fake Out, Grassy Terrain, and utility in U-turn pivoting or Taunt.
  • U-turn is the fourth move of choice on most Miracle Seed Rillaboom; however, Taunt can be used instead to help shut down Amoonguss, and Protect can be used to aid in positioning.
  • Miracle Seed allows Rillaboom to OHKO Primarina and Basculegion with Grassy Glide and OHKO Maushold with Wood Hammer.
  • Rillaboom does not Terastallize often, but Tera Grass can be used to finish off low HP Pokemon with Grassy Glide or to nuke bulkier threats. For example, Tera Grass allows Rillaboom to OHKO Annihilape with Wood Hammer. Tera Fire gives Rillaboom an immunity to Will-O-Wisp from Magmar and a resistance to common Fire- and Steel-type moves from Pokemon such as Incineroar, Hisuian Typhlosion, and Gholdengo.
  • The EV spread allows Rillaboom to survive a +2 Shadow Ball from Gholdengo, a Flare Blitz from Incineroar, and a Dire Claw from Sneasler.
  • Miracle Seed Rillaboom is able to deal extra damage, allowing it to break through teams more effectively. Additionally, it is able to use status moves such as Taunt and Protect that are not available to Assault Vest Rillaboom. However, Miracle Seed Rillaboom is less effective as a defensive pivot, as it takes significantly more damage from special moves.

Bulky Assault Vest.description:
Set Details

  • Rillaboom is a strong physical attacker and a flexible positional piece. Grassy Surge is able to power up its Grass-type attacks while giving its team passive recovery and Terrain control against Miraidon and Indeedee-F compositions. Its access to Fake Out and U-turn help partners set up and position safely. Its Grass-type STAB moves are valuable to hit the format's Water-types, such as Urshifu-R and Tera Water Calyrex-I.
  • Rillaboom runs both Wood Hammer and Grassy Glide to give it access to both strong burst damage and a priority attack to pick off foes at low HP, such as Choice Scarf Urshifu and Calyrex-S. High Horsepower can also be run to hit Pokemon like Incineroar, Miraidon, and Raging Bolt, though it prefers to run U-turn to help the team position correctly and reset Fake Out pressure.
  • Assault Vest patches up Rillaboom's mediocre Special Defense, allowing it to better take on special attackers such as Miraidon, Calyrex-S, and Kyogre. Its inability to use Protect is less relevant, as Rillaboom would often prefer to switch out when threatened in order to reset Fake Out pressure.
  • The allocated bulk allows Rillaboom to survive Helping Hand Draco Meteor from Timid Choice Specs Miraidon in the Grassy Terrain or a +2 Astral Barrage from Life Orb or Tera Ghost Calyex-S. The Attack investment allows Rillaboom to OHKO bulky Flutter Mane with Wood Hammer.
  • Tera Fire gives Rillaboom a resistance to the Ice and Fire-type attacks it was previously weak to, such as Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash, Calyrex-I's Glacial Lance, and Chi-Yu's Fire-type STAB moves. Tera Water gives similar defensive properties but doesn't leave Rillaboom weak to Calyrex-I's High Horsepower or Kyogre's Water-type STAB moves. In exchange, Tera Water Rillaboom gives up the immunity to getting burned and makes itself vulnerable against opposing Rillaboom.

Teambuilding

  • Calyrex-I, Koraidon, Ogerpon-H, Chi-Yu, and Chien-Pao all threaten to OHKO Rillaboom with their respective Fire and Ice-type attacks.
  • Rillaboom does not threaten Zamazenta-C or Zacian-C, while both threaten significant damage back.
  • Incineroar and Urshifu-R commonly pair with Rillaboom to form a Fire / Water / Grass core on balance teams. Incineroar and Urshifu-R are strong into the likes of Calyrex-I, Ogerpon-H, Chi-Yu, and Chien-Pao.
  • Calyrex-S and Terapagos appreciate Rillaboom's Fake Out support to allow them to set up, while Terapagos especially appreciates Rillaboom's Grassy Terrain recovery resetting Tera Shell. Calyrex-S can also remove opposing Koraidon.
  • Zamazenta-C appreciates Rillaboom's ability to remove physically bulky Water-types such as Urshifu-R and Tera-Water Calyrex-I, and it can protect Rillaboom from Glacial Lance thanks to Wide Guard. Zamazenta-C can also remove Chien-Pao to free up Rillaboom.

Hatterene.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Hatterene is really only prominently used in Trick Room teams due to its extremely inflexible Speed stat. However, once Trick Room is set up, Hatterene is there to deal as much damage as possible. It may also set up Trick Room, which paves the way for fellow Trick Room sweepers such as Torkoal and Ursaluna to clean up the game.

  • Indeedee-F serves as Hatterene's ideal partner, setting up Psychic Terrain to maximize the power of Expanding Force and make it into a spread move . It also provides redirection, allowing Hatterene to safely set up Trick Room while increasing Hatterene's survivability, and Helping Hand support to further accentuate Hatterene's damage output.

  • Hatterene is heavily threatened by Steel-types such as Kingambit and Gholdengo, which can deal considerable damage to it and comfortably tank its attacks. Ursaluna complements Hatterene as a fellow Trick Room sweeper where its STAB Ground-type attacks such as Earthquake and Headlong Rush can cover for Hatterene’s weaknesses while Hatterene can switch into and threaten the Fighting-types that threaten Ursaluna. Torkoal is another partner that provides offensive support with its Fire-type STAB moves against Steel- and Grass-types such as Rillaboom, which can override Psychic Terrain but is highly threatened by Eruption, deterring switch-ins. Another partner is Gallade, as it provides Wide Guard support, which is valuable against Eruption and Make It Rain from Hisuian Typhlosion and Gholdengo, respectively. Gallade's Fighting-type STAB moves are favorable in covering for Hatterene's Steel weakness, as well as hitting Dark-types such as Kingambit and Incineroar.

Strategy Comments

  • As a Trick Room sweeper, Hatterene ideally aims to set Trick Room and deal as much damage as possible. It works best when under Psychic Terrain, as it enables Expanding Force to deal its maximum potential output while protecting Hatterene from priority attacks such as Fake Out, Extreme Speed, and Sucker Punch.

  • As a result of being a more reliable Trick Room setter than others, Hatterene works well early in the game, setting up Trick Room on the first turn ideally while Indeedee-F redirects attacks before sweeping with Expanding Force. It can also choose to be in the back and let Indeedee-F or Gallade set Trick Room, allowing Hatterene to clean up the endgame once Trick Room is set up.

  • Rillaboom is one of the most threatening Pokemon against Hatterene, as not only can it threaten Hatterene with Wood Hammer, but it can also override Psychic Terrain, allowing priority attacks like Fake Out to bypass Trick Room. This also severely cuts Hatterene’s Expanding Force damage, making it more difficult for Hatterene to remove Rillaboom. Ways to mitigate Rillaboom could be to add Torkoal, which can threaten Rillaboom with Eruption. Indeedee-F can set Psychic Terrain after Rillaboom in the first turn; it is also possible to keep Indeedee-F in the back and switch it in after Rillaboom has entered the field.

Trick Room Sweeper.description:
• Due to its respectably high Special Attack and slow Speed stat, Hatterene serves as a formidable sweeper under Trick Room on Psychic-type spam teams due to maximizing damage output with its Psychic-type attacks, most noticeable Expanding Force. It serves as one of the most reliable Trick Room setters due to Magic Bounce, blocking status moves such as Taunt, Spore, and Sleep Powder.

  • Dazzling Gleam serves as a sufficient secondary STAB move that can cover for Dark-types that are immune to Expanding Force.

  • Protect discourages double-ups into Hatterene, as they would let a partner Pokemon set up Trick Room or pivot out for better positioning without letting Hatterene get heavily damaged. However, Hatterene can favor Mystical Fire over Protect as a coverage move that threatens Steel-types such as Gholdengo and Kingambit and Grass-types like Rillaboom, which can override Psychic Terrain.

  • Life Orb enables the flexibility of being able to use Trick Room or Protect while allowing Hatterene to still 2HKO most Pokemon neutral to Expanding Force, assuming Psychic Terrain is set up.

  • Tera Fire provides defensive flexibility against Steel-types such as Gholdengo and Archaludon, which gives it a higher chance of survivability for one turn and allows Hatterene to set up Trick Room in some cases. It also boosts the damage output of Mystical Fire, guaranteeing a 2HKO on Assault Vest Rillaboom and almost always OHKOing maximum HP Gholdengo and Kingambit. Tera Psychic, on the other hand, aims to maximize the damage output of Expanding Force, allowing it to OHKO Garchomp, Ursaluna-B, and Basculegion-M, as well as holding some defensive merits in removing weaknesses to Poison- and Steel-type attacks.

  • The EV spread lets Hatterene survive a Wave Crash from Adaptability Basculegion-M, a Dire Claw from Sneasler, and an Eruption from Timid Choice Specs Hisuian Typhlosion and give it an extremely favorable roll against a Torkoal Eruption. Hatterene at its lowest possible Speed stat can move before Amoonguss under Trick Room.

Dual Screens Support.description:
Set Details

  • Grimmsnarl's main role is to set up Light Screen and Reflect to increase the bulk of its partners. Grimmsnarl can also be an annoying disruptor with Thunder Wave and sometimes Parting Shot. Setting up dual screens is very effective against hyper offensive teams using Koraidon and Calyrex-S, as these teams are normally quite frail, and surviving one extra attack can often be the difference maker in those matchups.
  • Thunder Wave is a good option for disruption and speed control, allowing partners like Miraidon and Urshifu-R to outspeed Calyrex-S and Koraidon, while Parting Shot is good for further weakening foes and giving Grimmsnarl a strong pivoting option, which helps partners like Ho-Oh and Ursaluna activate their abilities of Regenerator and Guts, respectively, with less risk. Spirit Break OHKOes Koraidon before it Terastallizes, as well as being able to threaten both Urshifu formes, and it reduces the Special Attack of Pokemon such as Calyrex-S and Lunala. Foul Play allows Grimmsnarl to do significant damage to Calyrex-I, Calyrex-S, and Lunala.
  • Light Clay allows Reflect and Light Screen to last longer, allowing for prolonged damage mitigation even after Grimmsnarl has fainted.
  • The Special Defense investment allows Grimmsnarl to live a Moonblast from Timid Flutter Mane when Light Screen isn't up, and Grimmsnarl can also live a Choice Specs Miraidon Electro Drift when Light Screen is up. The Defense EVs let it survive Ursaluna's Guts-boosted Facade when behind Reflect.
  • Tera Ghost helps Grimmsnarl avoid Fake Out from Iron Hands, Rillaboom, and Incineroar, which can be crucial to allow Grimmsnarl to get dual screens up or use an extra Thunder Wave. It also gives it an immunity to Zamazenta-C's Body Press and removes the Heavy Slam and Behemoth Bash weaknesses.

Teambuilding

  • Urshifu-R ignores all of Grimmsnarl's damage mitigation with Surging Strikes, and some Choice Band variants can also OHKO Grimmsnarl with Surging Strikes. Taunt from Incineroar and Flutter Mane can effectively shut down Grimmsnarl's supportive ability, leaving it stuck using either Spirit Break or Foul Play. Galarian Weezing's Neutralizing Gas prevents Grimmsnarl from getting its dual screens off immediately, allowing Koraidon, which is usually paired with Galarian Weezing, to easily OHKO it with Tera Fire Flare Blitz.
  • Dark-, Electric-, and Ground-types like opposing Grimmsnarl, Incineroar, Miraidon, and Landorus are immune to Prankster Thunder Wave, reducing Grimmsnarl's effectiveness on the field. Fake Out from Rillaboom, Iron Hands, and Incineroar is also detrimental to Grimmsnarl, as it stops Grimmsnarl from supporting its team. Spore from Amoonguss and Brute Bonnet can make it difficult for Grimmsnarl to get both screens up in a game.
  • Grimmsnarl's dual screens are able to support most teams, but Miraidon, Ho-Oh, Lunala, and Calyrex-I especially enjoy Grimmsnarl's support because they typically favor bulkier playstyles. Miraidon is able to quickly remove Urshifu-R while also protecting Grimmsnarl from Spore with Electric Terrain, and Ho-Oh is a great check for Koraidon, as it resists all of its moves and threatens an OHKO with Brave Bird. Incineroar and Iron Hands provide support with Fake Out, which makes it easier to get both screens up, and Urshifu-R can threaten Taunt Incineroar and other Dark- and Ground-types, which are immune to Thunder Wave, with Close Combat and Surging Strikes.

Indeedee.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Indeedee-M pairs well with speed control or redirection that allow it to use Expanding Force without being KOed.
  • Priority Tailwind setters like Talonflame pair well with Indeedee-M, as they let it move first while also supporting the offensive teammates like Ursaluna-B that can weaken teams before Indeedee-M cleans up. Electabuzz provides speed control with Electro Web and redirects attacks with Follow Me.
  • Gholdengo completely walls Indeedee-M. Partners like Throat Chop Sneasler and Ursaluna-B can help with this, threatening Gholdengo and forcing it to Terastallize out of its resistance to Expanding Force.

Strategy Comments

  • Indeedee-M is primarily a cleaner with Expanding Force. It is at its best when the foes are weakened and in range of Expanding Force.
  • Since it wants to clean up, Indeedee-M thrives late-game once a partner like Ursaluna-B has dealt large amounts of damage.
  • Indeedee-M struggles with Psychic-resistant foes, specially bulky foes, or some combination of these like Incineroar, Kingambit, or Archaludon. Partners like the Ursaluna formes can help with the Steel- and Dark-types that resist Expanding Force, directly threatening Steel-types and taking advantage of the fact that most Dark-types are weak to Ground like Kingambit and Incineroar. Sneasler can threaten specially defensive foes like Assault Vest Kingambit and Archaludon with Close Combat or Dire Claw if they Terastallize, letting Indeedee-M finish them off late-game. Rillaboom is another threat, overriding Psychic Terrain and threatening Indeedee-M with Wood Hammer. Sneasler helps with this, pressuring Rillaboom with Dire Claw.

Glass Cannon.description:
• Indeedee-M is a fast Psychic Terrain setter that can both boost its partner's Psychic-type damage and use its Psychic Terrain for itself.
  • Expanding Force is Indeedee-M's main method of dealing damage, while the combination of Trick Room and Imprison lets it both set Trick Room against faster teams and deny it against opposing Trick Room. Choice Scarf sets opt for Dazzling Gleam as a spread damage attack to hit Dark-type Pokemon, Trick to potentially cripple Trick Room setters like Porygon2, and Tera Blast as an option for a Normal-type STAB attack. Protect can be used on Focus Sash sets for increased flexibility.
  • Focus Sash lets Indeedee-M survive at least one strong attack, letting it invest fully in Special Attack and Speed, while Choice Scarf lets it outspeed Pokemon like Sneasler and Dragapult.
  • Tera Psychic guarantees Expanding Force OHKOes Amoonguss, while Tera Blast Fighting lets Indeedee-M threaten Dark-types that otherwise wall it.

Indeedee-F.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Indeedee-F works best on dedicated Trick Room teams, using Follow Me to almost always guarantee its partner to set up Trick Room as well as pairing well with Trick Room sweepers. It sets up Psychic Terrain to prevent Fake Out from disturbing your team's Trick Room setup as well as preventing priority attacks from threatening its partners.

  • Ursaluna and Ursaluna-B are common partners for Indeedee-F. Trick Room can help with the speed control both Ursaluna formes need, and Follow Me can protect them from non-spread moves while allowing them to deal Normal-type damage with Blood Moon and Facade and Ground-type damage with Headlong Rush, Earthquake, and Earth Power. Other Trick Room sweepers, such as Hatterene and Torkoal, are the best Trick Room partners for Indeedee-F. Hatterene can threaten the opponent's team with heavy Psychic-type damage from Expanding Force, and Torkoal can threaten heavy Fire-type damage with Eruption, Weather Ball, and Heat Wave. Gallade can threaten Dark-type Pokemon with Sacred Sword and provide Wide Guard support to protect its side of the field from spread moves. Sneasler pairs nicely with Indeedee-F because Sneasler can hold the Psychic Seed, activating its Unburden ability.

  • Kingambit will decimate any opposing Indeedee-F. Even if Indeedee-F Terastallizes into a Fairy-type, Kingambit will still do significant amount of damage to it. Therefore, a Fighting-type Pokemon like Sneasler should be used to threaten Kingambit, as it can almost always guarantee a OHKO on Kingambit with Close Combat. Rillaboom is another threat to watch out for, as it can set up Grassy Terrain, which can override the Psychic Terrain that Indeedee-F sets up.

Strategy Comments

  • Indeedee-F is a support Pokemon. It redirects attacks with Follow Me, provides speed control with Trick Room, provides important chip damage with Psychic or Dazzling Gleam, and helps partners spam Expanding Force.

  • Indeedee-F is best used early-game. As a lead, it is really good to get a head start at initializing your strategy. Sneasler, Ursaluna-B , and Ursaluna are all common Pokemon to lead alongside Indeedee-F. The Sneasler + Indeedee-F lead doesn't require Trick Room to be utilized and does not require any other setup. The Ursaluna-B + Indeedee-F lead does not have to be in Trick Room, depending on the Speed investment of Ursaluna-B, and it unleashes some of the largest amount of special damage in the metagame. Ursaluna and Indeedee-F have to be in Trick Room and need Ursaluna's Guts boost to be utilized thoroughly. However, this lead provides some of the largest amount of physical damage in the metagame.

  • The biggest weakness Indeedee-F has to deal with is the move Taunt. Taunt prevents Indeedee-F from setting up Trick Room and doing its job as a supportive Pokemon. The most reliable way to get rid of Taunt is to switch Indeedee-F out. Sometimes, Indeedee-F has to rely on its ally to set up Trick Room instead. Because it is a Trick Room Pokemon, it is vulnerable to being double targeted, which prevents Trick Room from being set up. Fortunately, it has Follow Me, which can redirect non-spread moves to it, allowing its ally to set up Trick Room.

Bulky Support.description:
• Indeedee-F is a support Pokemon that mainly redirects attacks with Follow Me and sets up Trick Room. The Psychic Terrain that it sets up supports its teammates by protecting them from opposing priority moves like Sucker Punch and Fake Out.

  • Follow Me provides redirection so that an allied Pokemon can safely set up Tailwind or Trick Room or set up with moves such as Annihilape's Bulk Up, Kingambit's Swords Dance, and Kommo-o's Clangorous Soul. Imprison prevents Trick Room from being set up by foes and shuts down the opponent's Follow Me Pokemon. Dazzling Gleam is mainly used to break opposing Pokemon that hold Focus Sash.

  • Safety Goggles provides immunity to Amoonguss's Spore and Rage Powder while allowing Indeedee-F to use Follow Me to redirect Spore. Psychic Seed ensures that it takes attacks like Ursaluna-B's Blood Moon better. Rocky Helmet punishes any Pokemon that attack it with contact-making moves or have said attacks redirected to it. Some of these contact moves are Annihilape's Drain Punch and Rage Fist, Rillaboom's Wood Hammer, and Sneasler's Dire Claw and Close Combat. Rocky Helmet also has the ability to break Focus Sashes and threaten any Pokemon that use multi-hit moves, such as Maushold and its Population Bomb. Sitrus Berry helps out Indeedee-F's longevity by allowing it to survive moves like +4 Archaludon's Body Press and Pelipper's Weather Ball.

  • Fairy is the best Tera type for Indeedee-F. It provides resistances to Kingambit's Kowtow Cleave and Sucker Punch, Archaludon's Body Press, and Sneasler's Close Combat and Throat Chop and an immunity to Dragon-type moves from Archaludon, Dragonite, Garchomp, and Dragapult. As a little bonus, it offers a STAB boost to Dazzling Gleam. Tera Grass gives Indeedee-F a resistance to Grass-type moves such as Rillaboom's Wood Hammer and Water-type moves such as Basculegion-M's Wave Crash and Pelipper's rain-boosted Weather Ball, which are its partners' most common weaknesses. Tera Grass also provides immunity to Amoonguss's Spore and redirection. However, if Indeedee-F uses Safety Goggles, Tera Grass is not recommended.

Trick Room Support.description:
Set Details

  • Indeedee-F is a great support option for many teams, utilizing its Normal typing to take no damage from Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage and Lunala's Moongeist Beam while also setting Psychic Terrain to not only shut off Miraidon's Electric Terrain but also to guard its teammates from priority moves such as Fake Out, as well as Sucker Punch and Thunderclap from Chien-Pao and Raging Bolt, respectively.
  • Psychic provides Indeedee-F with a way to deal consistent damage, while Alluring Voice scares off Dark-types like Chien-Pao and Tera Dark Calyrex-S.
  • Safety Goggles is useful for Indeedee-F to safely redirect Spore from Amoonguss and Smeargle, while Rocky Helmet punishes certain physical attackers, most notably Urshifu-R. Psychic Seed, although less common, is a good choice to help take on special attackers like the aforementioned Calyrex-S and Raging Bolt.
  • If running a Trick Room team, a Relaxed Nature and 0 Speed IVs let Indeedee-F override Grassy Terrain against uninvested Rillaboom if both are sent on the field at the same time; it also lets Indeedee-F be as slow as possible for operating under Trick Room.
  • Tera Water grants Indeedee-F a great defensive typing, helping it stomach moves such as Glacial Lance and Surging Strikes from Calyrex-I and Urshifu-R, respectively. Tera Fairy, on the other hand, most notably lets Indeedee-F resist Dark-types like Chi-Yu, Incineroar, and Chien-Pao. Although niche, Tera Fairy also boosts the power of Alluring Voice, letting it almost always OHKO Koraidon and securing the OHKO on Urshifu-S.

Teambuilding

  • Indeedee-F is very vulnerable to Taunt from the likes of Incineroar and Flutter Mane, as it severely hinders Indeedee-F's supportive capabilities and stops it from redirecting attacks or setting up Trick Room.
  • Without Terastallization available, Dark-type attacks like Wicked Blow from Urshifu and Dark Pulse from Chi-Yu threaten Indeedee-F with a potential OHKO. Chien-Pao in particular is a big threat to Indeedee-F, as it not only threatens Indeedee-F with Crunch, but it can also remove Psychic Terrain with Ice Spinner.
  • Miraidon and Rillaboom are able to override Indeedee-F's Psychic Terrain with their own respective Terrains, forcing Indeedee-F to switch out if it wants to set up Psychic Terrain again.
  • Packing multiple Trick Room setters like Calyrex-I and Lunala can ensure that Taunt won't shut down Trick Room altogether. Said Trick Room setters benefit from Indeedee-F's access to Follow Me and Trick Room, potentially setting up Trick Room for the aforementioned Restricted Pokemon and protecting them while they sweep via redirection.
  • Partners such as the Urshifu formes and Zamazenta-C are able to threaten Dark-types with a KO with Close Combat and Body Press, respectively. Zamazenta-C is notably able to almost completely wall out Chien-Pao, unless it has Sacred Sword. Running Alluring Voice or using Whimsicott can also help with Dark-types to an extent. Indeedee-F can help these partners more easily achieve these KOs with Helping Hand, or it can protect its allies from faster threats with Follow Me.
  • Calyrex-I is able to easily take out Miraidon and Rillaboom, which can be achieved even easier thanks to Indeedee-F's access to Trick Room and Helping Hand.
  • Calyrex-S and Lunala highly appreciate Indeedee-F's assistance, enabling powerful Expanding Forces with Psychic Terrain whilst helping Calyrex-S set up with Nasty Plot and Lunala set up Trick Room, thanks to Follow Me. Lunala in particular appreciates Indeedee-F's ability to set Trick Room. In return, Calyrex-S and Lunala can KO powerful threats such as Koraidon, which can threaten Indeedee-F with an OHKO.

Dragapult.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Dragapult is a common attacker on balance teams with bulky redirectors, such as Electabuzz, Magmar, and Clefable. Redirectors are vital, since they assist in keeping Dragapult around for longer, which is especially important because Dragapult is frail and is weak to Sucker Punch from threats such as Kingambit. Additionally, Dragapult appreciates Fake Out support from the likes of Rillaboom, as it gives free turns for Dragapult to get extra attacks off, and it works nicely with Phantom Force, preventing a foe from attacking Dragapult after it lands the attack.
  • Dragapult appreciates partners that can cover its weaknesses offensively or that can reliably switch into its checks; some examples are Sneasler and Primarina. Sneasler is a fast attacker that can outspeed and threaten Dark- and Fairy-types such as Incineroar, Kingambit, and Primarina. Primarina is a slower, bulkier attacker that can switch into attacks easier while still having the ability to OHKO threats such as Incineroar.
  • Dark-types such as Kingambit and Incineroar are the biggest checks to Dragapult, as they can easily shrug off its attacks and threaten it with an OHKO. The aforementioned partners can help against these threats by threatening them and redirecting attacks, buying more time for Dragapult to switch out safely or overwhelm them with strong Dragon-type attacks. Tailwind teams can also be a big problem to Dragapult, as it relies on being faster than its foes and getting lots of damage off before they can move. Partners such as Rillaboom and Kingambit can help against Tailwind teams, since they can attack foes with strong priority moves, stall turns with smart pivoting, and, in Rillaboom's case, use Fake Out.

Strategy Comments

  • Dragapult is a sweeper, and it requires a lot of smart positioning to use it to its maximum potential. Dragapult shines in positions where its partners can support it either offensively by threatening its checks or defensively by aiding in its longevity. U-turn is a great tool in this regard, as it allows Dragapult to escape from tricky positions while doing chip damage to a foe.
  • Dragapult utilizes Terastallization to get major damage on enemy Pokemon throughout the course of the game. Dragapult can be utilized early-game to get off powerful Tera Dragon Dragon Darts or Tera Blast Ghost, or it can be utilized late-game to clean the enemy team with Dragon Darts and Phantom Force.
  • Dragapult's biggest weakness is Pokemon that resist its STAB attacks, such as Kingambit, Alolan Ninetales, and Incineroar. Dragapult utilizes its partners to help against these threats until they are weakened to a point where Dragapult can finish them off. Priority attacks such as Sucker Punch from Kingambit and forms of speed control, such as Tailwind and Trick Room, are threatening to Dragapult, as it is frail and relies on its high damage output and outspeeding foes. Against priority attacks, Dragapult pivots partners in or utilizes an ally with redirection to take the attacks for it. Against Tailwind and Trick Room teams, Dragapult again uses smart pivots and defensive tools such as Follow Me and Fake Out to stall out turns of Trick Room, allowing it to clean up late-game.

Glass Cannon.description:
• Dragapult uses its powerful STAB attacks, phenomenal Speed, and solid Attack stat to outrun almost every Pokemon in the game and deal massive damage to the opposing team.
  • Dragon Darts is great at consistently chipping down the opposing team. Phantom Force is Dragapult's strongest Ghost-type STAB move that can also shatter Protect, but it allows foes to switch due to its charging turn. Tera Dragon sets prefer Outrage to nuke foes, albeit inconsistently. On the other hand, Tera Blast Ghost is a reliable one-turn Ghost-type STAB move. U-turn allows Dragapult to get chip damage on foes and pivot out of tricky matchups while dealing respectable damage to threats such as Rillaboom.
  • Choice Band boosts Dragapult's Attack stat to great levels, which pairs excellently with its high Speed.
  • Tera Dragon allows Dragapult to OHKO Garchomp and Hydreigon with one hit from Dragon Darts and Incineroar, Electabuzz, and Magmar with Outrage. Additionally, Tera Dragon removes Dragapult's weakness to Sucker Punch from Kingambit. Tera Ghost is used, since it gives Dragapult a consistent physical Ghost-type attack in Tera Blast Ghost while also allowing it to OHKO Volcarona and Primarina with Phantom Force.
  • An Adamant nature allows Dragapult to always OHKO Volcarona with Outrage and almost always OHKO a Terastallized Hisuian Typhlosion with Phantom Force. A Jolly nature allows Dragapult to outspeed Jolly Talonflame, Adamant Choice Scarf Basculegion-M, and opposing Adamant Dragapult.

Bulky Attacker.description:
Set Details

  • Zacian-C has a unique niche in Regulation I thanks to its blistering Speed and excellent typing, allowing Zacian-C to threaten OHKOs on metagame staples like Miraidon, Koraidon, and Grimmsnarl.
  • Swords Dance is in Zacian-C's standard moveset, as it allows Zacian-C to boost its Attack faster than Incineroar's Intimidate would drop it and ensures Zacian-C remains a threat. Sacred Sword can be used instead to score 2HKOs on Zamazenta-C and Incineroar, which Zacian-C otherwise struggles to handle. Substitute is a good alternative, as it provides a superior matchup against Will-O-Wisp Incineroar and maintains momentum by protecting Zacian-C from being flinched by Fake Out. Thanks to Zacian-C's Speed, Substitute can also act as a secondary form of Protect and help Zacian-C scout opposing Protect and Terastallization, such as Tera Fairy Miraidon.
  • The EV spread ensures Zacian-C survives Flare Blitz from Life Orb Koraidon and Guts-boosted Headlong Rush from Ursaluna after Terastallization, as well as surviving Volt Switch from Choice Specs Miraidon and avoiding the 2HKO from Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage. The Speed investment allows Zacian-C to outspeed base 135s like Chien-Pao, Koraidon, and Miraidon. Finally, the Attack investment picks up an OHKO on Grimmsnarl behind Reflect with a Behemoth Blade.
  • Tera Fairy is an incredibly consistent Tera type, ​as it sheds Zacian-C's weaknesses and bolsters its damage output, achieving feats such as OHKOing maximum HP Miraidon with Play Rough at +0 Attack.

Teambuilding

  • Zacian-C especially struggles with Incineroar, as it can mitigate Zacian-C's damage output in various ways. Volcarona and Ogerpon-H are other problematic Pokemon, as they redirect and resist Zacian-C's STAB moves; Volcarona possesses the potential to permanently cripple Zacian-C with Flame Body, while Ogerpon-H threatens to OHKO with Tera Fire Ivy Cudgel.
  • Calyrex-S is an issue, as a lot of Zacian-C's viability comes from its Speed tier, so Calyrex-S compositions will have a much easier time supporting Calyrex-S and countering Zacian-C than vice versa. Zamazenta-C is difficult for Zacian-C without Sacred Sword, as Zamazenta-C comfortably wins one-on-one.
  • Kyogre and Urshifu-R are exceptional partners, as they blast all the Fire-types that frustrate Zacian-C. In return, Zacian-C can threaten the problematic Dragon-types like Raging Bolt, Koraidon, and Miraidon. Kyogre helps Zacian-C further by negating its weakness to Fire-type moves through setting up rain.
  • Amoonguss and Incineroar are useful partners, as they can help Zacian-C set up safely. Incineroar can greatly aid with Calyrex-S and Ogerpon-H, pressuring them with its STAB attacks and Parting Shot. Amoonguss makes Zamazenta-C far easier to take on and can shut down Incineroar that aren't holding Safety Goggles with Spore and Rage Powder.
  • Chien-Pao and Landorus form great offensive synergies with Zacian-C. Chien-Pao increases Zacian-C's damage output with Sword of Ruin and pressures Calyrex-S before it can move with Sucker Punch. With Sword of Ruin, Zacian-C can OHKO bulky Kyogre with Tera Fairy Play Rough and almost always 2HKOes Zamazenta-C at neutral Attack. Chien-Pao notably threatens Rillaboom and Amoonguss, meaning it also synergizes with other common Zacian-C partners. Landorus has more direct synergy, as it can threaten OHKOs on Incineroar, Zamazenta-C, and Ogerpon-H and provides a safer Miraidon endgame as a Ground-type. Both Pokemon help force pins on Miraidon and Raging Bolt, as Zacian-C can cover for Tera Fairy.

Set Details

  • With its incredible bulk, high damage, and good Speed, Zamazenta-C can be a very powerful threat to many teams. It can do great damage with Body Press and protect its allies well from Pokemon such as Calyrex-S, Chi-Yu, Miraidon, Kyogre and Terapagos-S with Wide Guard. It can also wall common threats such as Chien-Pao, Rillaboom, and Ogerpon-C.
  • Behemoth Bash is a consistent damage choice for Zamazenta-C, as it can do good damage to Calyrex-I and Tera Fairy Miraidon and Raging Bolt. Heavy Slam does more damage against the general metagame but doesn't do much to the aforementioned Pokemon.
  • The EV spread allows it to outspeed maximum speed Landorus. It also lets Zamazenta-C live Close Combat from Life Orb Koraidon.
  • Tera Dragon switches all of Zamazenta-C's weaknesses to neutralities or resistances, and the added resistsances can be very useful against the likes of Koraidon, Miraidon, Urshifu-R, and Kyogre.

Teambuilding

  • Zamazenta-C can struggle with Koraidon, which can do massive damage to it. Electric Seed Lunala sets can wall Zamazenta-C and do respectable damage with Moongeist Beam. Ho-Oh resists both of Zamazenta-C's STAB moves, can do good damage and burn it with Sacred Fire, and sets up Tailwind. Amoonguss can also cause Zamazenta-C trouble, since Amoonguss doesn't take much damage from it and can threaten back with Spore or redirect Zamazenta-C's attacks. Landorus can OHKO Zamazenta-C with Earth Power if it has Life Orb or outspeed it and do massive damage with Choice Scarf while resisting Body Press. Volcarona can also check Zamazenta-C incredibly well by resisting both of its STAB moves and having a chance to burn Zamazenta-C, heavily reducing its offensive capabilities.
  • Calyrex-S is the most common Restricted Pokemon pairing with Zamazenta-C. Together, they have amazing coverage, and Zamazenta-C can protect it from opposing Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage with Wide Guard. Calyrex-S also deals with Koraidon and Amoonguss with Psychic. Miraidon can also be a strong partner for Zamazenta-C by doing incredible damage to a ton of its checks, such as Ho-Oh, Koraidon, and Amoonguss, and taking advantage of its defensive capabilities, with Zamazenta-C being a good partner to pivot to with Volt Switch. Chien-Pao works really well with Zamazenta-C, since it boosts Body Press's damage, allowing Zamazenta-C to OHKO Pokemon like Terapagos-S and Incineroar, and deals well with most of its checks, hitting Koraidon, Lunala, Amoonguss, and Landorus hard. Another common partner is Rillaboom, setting its Terrain to give Zamazenta-C even more survivability with its healing and allow it to survive Choice Specs Electro Drift from Miraidon.

Glass Cannon.description:
Set Details

  • Urshifu-S utilizes its STAB attacks to threaten Restricted Pokemon like Calyrex-S, Calyrex-I, and Terapagos alongside other metagame staples like Chien-Pao, Ursaluna, and Chi-Yu.
  • Focus Sash allows Urshifu-S to take two attacks before it is KOed to maximize its on-field presence. Covert Cloak provides Urshifu-S with a strong matchup against Calyrex-S and Terapagos team compositions featuring dual Fake Out cores.
  • Covert Cloak sets use an EV spread of 132 HP / 236 Atk / 4 Def / 76 SpD / 60 Spe with and Adamant nature. This spread is designed to let Urshifu-S survive at least two Astral Barrages from Life Orb-boosted Calyrex-S and outrun maximum Speed Incineroar, with the remainder of the EVs invested into Attack and Defense.
  • Tera Stellar guarantees Urshifu-S's Wicked Blow OHKOes Lunala through Shadow Shield.

Teambuilding

  • Urshifu-S struggles to sufficiently damage Tera Fairy foes such as Miraidon, Lunala, and Raging Bolt, as well as being threatened by Fairy-type attacks like Dazzling Gleam from Miraidon, Moonblast from Lunala and Flutter Mane, and Play Rough from Zacian-C.
  • Fighting-type attacks are problematic for Urshifu-S. Koraidon and Zamazenta-C outspeed and easily KO Urshifu-S with Collision Course and Body Press after its Focus Sash has been broken. Meanwhile, Urshifu-R and Iron Hands can survive Urshifu-S's attacks and KO it in return with Close Combat and Drain Punch, respectively.
  • Incineroar is threatening, since Urshifu-S struggles to remove it before its damage output is hindered by Intimidate and Will-O-Wisp.
  • A partner Miraidon threatens opposing Miraidon, Raging Bolt, and Koraidon with Draco Meteor and Dazzling Gleam, as well as dealing good damage with Electro Drift to them and Incineroar after they Terastallize.
  • Calyrex-I survives Electro Drift, Draco Meteor, and Thunderbolt from Miraidon and Raging Bolt and easily KOes them alongside Koraidon with Glacial Lance. Urshifu-S returns the favor by checking Calyrex-I's threats like Lunala and Calyrex-S with Wicked Blow and Sucker Punch.
  • Landorus can easily threaten Miraidon, Raging Bolt, and Incineroar with Earth Power and Sandsear Storm in addition to threatening Tera Fairy users with Sludge Bomb. Meanwhile, Urshifu-S threatens the foes that can attack before Landorus or survive its onslaught like Calyrex-S and Lunala.
  • Amoonguss pairs well with Urshifu-S, comfortably surviving and redirecting Fairy- and Fighting-type attacks for it on top of disrupting foes with Spore.

Choice Band.description:
Set Details

  • Choice Band Urshifu-S uses Wicked Blow to reliably OHKO foes like Calyrex-I, Lunala, Volcarona, and Farigiraf while maintaining its naturally good matchups against Calyrex-S and Indeedee-F.
  • With Close Combat, Urshifu-S is able to threaten KOs on Incineroar, Ursaluna, and even Defense Protosynthesis-boosted Brute Bonnet.
  • U-turn allows Urshifu-S to pivot out in situations that may not be favorable for it while doing significant damage to Brute Bonnet and Indeedee-F. Additionally, U-turn can be used to play around defensive Terastallization from Pokemon like Calyrex-I, Lunala, and Farigiraf.
  • While Choice Band does have the obvious downside of locking Urshifu-S into a move, its newfound ability to OHKO Calyrex-I and Lunala with Wicked Blow, alongside its generally higher damage output, allows it to be much more threatening.
  • Urshifu-S should use either a Brave Nature with 252 HP and Attack EVs or an Adamant Nature with 252 Attack and Speed EVs depending on if it is being used on a team that focuses on Trick Room or not. Trick Room teams should run 0 IVs in Speed, while teams not utilizing Trick Room should use 31 IVs in Speed.
  • Tera Grass is the most common Tera type, as it allows Urshifu-S to avoid Rage Powder and Spore from opposing Pokemon like Volcarona and Amoonguss, respectively.

Teambuilding

  • Choice Band Urshifu-S is weak to Fighting-types like Urshifu-R, Iron Hands, and Zamazenta-C, as they can all survive Urshifu's Close Combat and OHKO it back. However, Urshifu-S can OHKO Zamazenta-C with Close Combat if its Dauntless Shield boost is no longer active.
  • Choice Band Urshifu-S is also susceptible to opposing Pokemon's use of Terastallization, as Pokemon like Calyrex-I and Lunala can use a defensive Tera type to survive a hit from Urshifu-S. Lunala is especially scary for Urshifu-S in these scenarios, as it can sometimes run Tera Fairy and Moonblast to survive a hit and OHKO Urshifu-S in return.
  • Choice Band Urshifu-S is strongest on Trick Room teams that feature Restricted Pokemon like Lunala and Calyrex-I, as those teams can use it to threaten OHKOs on Pokemon like Calyrex-I, Calyrex-S, and Lunala. Lunala and Calyrex-I can assist Urshifu-S in return by setting up Trick Room and allowing it to move before Pokemon like Chi-Yu and Zamazenta-C.
  • Another good teammate for Urshifu-S is Indeedee-F, as it appreciates Urshifu-S's ability to threaten Ursaluna before Trick Room goes up. Indeedee-F supports Urshifu-S well by providing Trick Room and redirection, which both allow Urshifu-S to more effectively take KOs.

Choice Locked.description:
Set Details

  • Urshifu-R is one of the format's top offensive threats, thanks to its high Attack and strong STAB moves. Unseen Fist allows Urshifu-R to circumvent foes' Protect, which reduces the number of defensive plays the opponent can go for if you can position Urshifu-R correctly. Urshifu-R has especially strong matchups against Incineroar, Chi-Yu, Chien-Pao, and Terapagos.
  • U-turn allows Urshifu-R to reposition while dealing chip damage to threats such as Rillaboom. Aqua Jet allows Urshifu-R to pick off faster foes at low HP. Coaching can be used to boost the Attack and Defense of teammates, usually Calyrex-I. Rock Tomb is a more niche option that can be used for speed control, and it's especially appreciated by Calyrex-S in the mirror matchup.
  • Urshifu-R's Choice Scarf allows it to outspeed most of the metagame, most importantly Calyrex-S, ensuring it can get strong attacks off. Choice Band is a more niche option to boost Urshifu-R's damage output further, allowing it to 2HKO Calyrex-I with Surging Strikes or Close Combat.
  • The allocated bulk allows Urshifu-R to survive Incineroar's Fake Out into Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage, while the Attack investment allows Tera Water Choice Scarf Urshifu-R to OHKO most Calyrex-S.
  • Tera Water boosts the damage of Surging Strikes, which allows Choice Scarf Urshifu-R to OHKO most Calyrex-S. It also removes Urshifu-R's weakness to Psychic- and Fairy-type attacks. Tera Ghost gives an immunity to Fake Out as well as Zamazenta-C's Body Press and opposing Urshifu formes' Close Combat.

Teambuilding

  • Raging Bolt can OHKO Urshifu-R with its priority Thunderclap. Flutter Mane and Whimsicott also threaten to OHKO Urshifu-R with Moonblast, with the former outspeeding it and the latter resisting all its STAB attacks. Amoonguss can safely redirect all of Urshifu-R's attacks and potentially deal damage back with Rocky Helmet.
  • Koraidon's sun weakens the damage of Surging Strikes, while Life Orb Close Combat will OHKO Urshifu-R. Choice Specs Miraidon OHKOes Urshifu-R with any of its attacks.
  • Rillaboom and Incineroar's pivot moves allow Choice Scarf Urshifu-R to get in position safely. Strong speed control options such as Tornadus's Prankster Tailwind and Lunala's Trick Room can ensure Choice Band Urshifu-R is always moving first.
  • Tornadus's Bleakwind Storm and Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash threaten the Grass-types that are strong against Urshifu-R as well as Miraidon and Raging Bolt.
  • Kyogre and Pelipper set the rain to power up Urshifu's Surging Strikes as well as overriding Koraidon's sun. Calyrex-I benefits from Urshifu-R's Coaching, which allows Calyrex-I to better take on Koraidon and Groudon.

Glass Cannon.description:
Set Details

  • Urshifu-R serves as an offensive threat within the metagame, being able to raise the offensive pressure of the battle with its Unseen Fist ability deterring Protect while hitting hard with powerful STAB moves. It has a good matchup against Incineroar, as Surging Strikes does not get slowed down by Intimidate, as well as Flutter Mane, as Focus Sash allows Surging Strikes to reliably KO it.
  • Aqua Jet is a reliable priority move for finishing off low HP targets. Taunt cripples the supportive capabilities of Pokemon such as Amoonguss, Indeedee-F, and Grimmsnarl, as well as blocking Calyrex-I and Farigiraf from setting Trick Room up.
  • Focus Sash allows Urshifu-R to retaliate against certain Pokemon that would normally outspeed and OHKO it before Urshifu-R could attack, such as Calyrex-S and Flutter Mane.
  • Tera Stellar provides Urshifu-R offensive variety because it boosts Close Combat, allowing it to OHKO non-Defense Protosynthesis Brute Bonnet. However, since the boost is only provided one time to each attack, Tera Water could be preferred, as it consistently boosts the damage output of Surging Strikes, allowing it to OHKO Ursaluna, Chien-Pao, Ogerpon-C, and Calyrex-S after Life Orb chip damage while also removing its Psychic, Flying, and Fairy weaknesses to give it some survivability if Focus Sash is broken.

Teambuilding

  • Urshifu-R heavily struggles against Raging Bolt and Rillaboom, which easily threaten it with Thunderclap and Grassy Glide, respectively, and resist Surging Strikes. Amoonguss and Indeedee-F can disrupt Urshifu-R from attacking ideal targets via redirection and potentially break Urshifu-R's Focus Sash if they hold a Rocky Helmet. Indeedee-F's Psychic is able to KO Urshifu-R if Focus Sash is broken; Amoonguss notably takes pitiful damage, as it resists both of Urshifu-R's STAB moves, allowing it to easily put Urshifu-R to sleep with Spore.
  • Koraidon and Miraidon both outspeed and threaten Urshifu-R while resisting Surging Strikes. On top of this, Koraidon's sun reduces Surging Strikes's damage output, and Miraidon can pivot with Volt Switch while breaking Focus Sash easily.
  • Urshifu-R heavily appreciates Calyrex-I, which threatens Rillaboom, Amoonguss, Koraidon, Miraidon, and Raging Bolt with Glacial Lance, while Urshifu-R can, in return, threaten Dark-types such as Incineroar, Chi-Yu, and Chien-Pao that threaten Calyrex-I. Calyrex-I's Trick Room allows Urshifu-R to stay ahead of opposing Pokemon that would otherwise outspeed it, such as the aforementioned Miraidon and Koraidon.
  • Tornadus threatens the Grass-types such as Rillaboom and Amoonguss that annoy Urshifu-R and can Taunt the Amoonguss, preventing it from disrupting Urshifu-R. Tornadus can also remove Koraidon's sun with Rain Dance, decreasing Koraidon's damage output while increasing that of Urshifu-R's Water-type attacks. Tornadus's Bleakwind Storm paired with Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes forces Koraidon to take super effective damage whether it Terastallizes or not.
  • Urshifu-R complements Miraidon and Lunala compositions as a reliable attacker that counters Incineroar, a problematic threat to these compositions. Meanwhile, Urshifu-R's coverage against Dark-types also benefits Lunala; in exchange, Lunala's Moongeist Beam is threatening to Ghost-types like opposing Lunala. Miraidon's Draco Meteor can quickly remove the Dragon-types such as Raging Bolt and Koraidon that resists Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes.
  • Rillaboom and Incineroar work well with Urshifu-R, as Fake Out and pivoting moves create opportunities for Urshifu-R to safety switch in without breaking Focus Sash, and their typing allows them to tank moves that Urshifu-R would be threatened by, such as Wood Hammer from Rillaboom, Psychic from Calyrex-S, and Electro Drift from Miraidon. Incineroar also threatens sizable damage towards Psychic-types like Indeedee-F and Lunala with Knock Off. Rillaboom helps reduce Miraidon's damage output by removing Electric Terrain while also being able to threaten Fake Out.

Mystic Water.description:
Set Details

  • Mystic Water Urshifu-R is a highly versatile and offensive Pokemon that performs well against foes like Terapagos, Incineroar, and Chien-Pao by threatening them all with Surging Strikes and Close Combat.
  • Taunt prevents Trick Room from foes like Calyrex-I and Lunala, setup from Volcarona and Terapagos, and moves like Rage Powder and Spore from Pokemon like Volcarona and Amoonguss. Aqua Jet is also a great option to finish off weakened foes and deal chip damage before Urshifu-R faints.
  • Mystic Water gives Urshifu-R the ability to OHKO Pokemon it otherwise could not, such as Chien-Pao, Incineroar, and bulky Flutter Mane with Surging Strikes.
  • The EV spread lets it take Life Orb-boosted Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S, Life Orb-boosted Earth Power from Landorus, Horn Leech from Ogerpon-C, Sword of Ruin-boosted Body Press from Zamazenta-C, and Sword of Ruin-boosted Grassy Glide from Rillaboom. The Speed EVs let it outpace Pokemon like Miradon and Chien-Pao after a Speed drop.
  • Tera Water functions as both an offensive and defensive Tera type by removing its Psychic, Fairy, and Flying weaknesses while also boosting its Water-type moves to let Urshifu-R OHKO Calyrex-S and most Grimmsnarl with Surging Strikes as well as Chi-Yu with Aqua Jet.

Teambuilding

  • Urshifu-R struggles against Restricted Pokemon like Koraidon, which weakens Surging Strikes by setting sun. It also has a hard time versus Miraidon, which can outspeed and threaten an OHKO with Volt Switch or Electro Drift.
  • Non-Restricted Pokemon that can take Urshifu-R's attacks like Iron Hands, Raging Bolt, and Rillaboom, which also threaten Urshifu-R before and after Terastallization, are very effective against it as well. Amoonguss can redirect and easily survive Urshifu-R's attacks and punish Surging Strikes if Amoonguss is holding a Rocky Helmet. Ogerpon-H and -C pose an offensive threat to Urshifu-R with potential OHKOs using Wood Hammer or Power Whip.
  • Urshifu-R heavily benefits from Tailwind, making setters like Whimsicott and Tornadus great partners. Tornadus also provides Rain Dance to boost its Water-type attacks significantly, while Whimsicott can provide Light Screen support, which lets Urshifu-R survive attacks such as a Protosynthesis-boosted Thunderclap from Raging Bolt and Flutter Mane's Moonblast.
  • Miraidon is a strong Restricted partner for Urshifu-R, as it prevents Spore from Amoonguss and can threaten Water- and Dragon-type foes that Urshifu-R struggles to damage, like Koraidon and opposing Urshifu-R. Urshifu-R also supports Miraidon by helping against Ground-types like Ursaluna and Landorus.
  • Calyrex-I and Lunala are also strong Restricted partners for Urshifu-R because they can set Trick Room to provide another form of speed control. Calyrex-I also helps cover Miraidon by threatening it with powerful Ground- and Ghost-type coverage, while Urshifu-R supports them by checking Incineroar.
  • Kyogre benefits Urshifu-R by setting rain, increasing the power of its Water-type moves.
  • Chien-Pao boosts Urshifu-R’s attacks with Sword of Ruin, allowing it to OHKO Ogerpon-H with Surging Strikes while also threatening Miraidon, Raging Bolt, and Rillaboom with Ice Spinner or Icicle Crash.
  • Balance staples like Rillaboom and Incineroar also support Urshifu-R, as they can pivot into attacks Urshifu-R would rather avoid and provide Fake Out pressure that synergizes well with Unseen Fist.

Bulky Attacker.description:
Set Details

  • Calyrex-I is a physical attacker that uses its incredible bulk and high Attack to threaten the high number of Grass- and Dragon-type Pokemon such as Miraidon, Koraidon, Rillaboom, Amoonguss, and Raging Bolt that could be problematic for its teammates. Calyex-I also works well in Trick Room thanks to its low Speed and access to the move.
  • Leech Seed allows Calyrex-I to work better into Pokemon that resist Glacial Lance such as Zamazenta-C while also giving it more of a staying presence because of the HP recovery. High Horsepower threatens Incineroar and Zamazenta-C, which resist Glacial Lance. Both moves help into Zamazenta-C; Leech Seed tries to stall out Zamazenta-C's health, while High Horsepower punishes Wide Guard.
  • Leftovers is ran with Leech Seed to allow Calyrex-I to recover even more of its HP after each turn, while Clear Amulet sets allow Calyrex-I to be unhindered by Intimidate and Parting Shot from Incineroar.
  • The Special Defense and HP investment let Calyrex-I survive Electro Drift from Choice Specs Miraidon while Electric Terrain is active. Calyrex-I can sometimes opt to run less Special Defense in order to invest more into Attack on Clear Amulet sets, but this comes at the cost of worse rolls into Choice Specs Miraidon and Life Orb Calyrex-S. The increased Attack investment allows Calyrex-I to threaten Koraidon with an OHKO if it doesn't Terastalize.
  • Tera Water allows Calyrex-I to resist Water- and Fire-type moves that would previously threaten it such as Water Spout from Kyogre and Flare Blitz from Koraidon. Tera Fire gives Calyrex-I a resistance to the previously mentioned Fire-type attacks while also making it immune to Will-O-Wisp from Incineroar, though it makes Calyrex-I worse into Urshifu-R because Surging Strikes threatens it after Terastallizing and common Urshifu-R partners like Calyrex-S threaten Calyrex-I before Terastallizing. Both Tera types help into Zacian-C and Zamazenta-C, as they allow Calyrex-I to resist Steel-type attacks from the aforementioned foes.

Teambuilding

  • Calyrex-I struggles against bulkier Pokemon such as Grimmsnarl, Terastallized Amoonguss, and Incineroar that aren't immediately threatened by Glacial Lance and can annoy Calyrex-I with Reflect, Spore, or Will-O-Wisp if it isn't Tera Fire. Offensive Pokemon such as Calyrex-S and Miraidon can also be problematic, as they threaten huge damage against Calyrex-I.
  • Miraidon pairs very well with Calyrex-I, as it threatens the bulkier Pokemon that Calyrex-I struggles with and denies Spore from Amoonguss and Brute Bonnet, while Calyrex-I threatens the Grass-, Ground-, and Dragon-type Pokemon that resist Miraidon's Electric-type attacks. Calyrex-I also discourages Rillaboom, a common check to Miraidon. Kyogre is another good Restricted Pokemon to pair with Calyrex-I. Kyogre threatens Incineroar with its Water-type attacks and works well in the Trick Room that Calyrex-I sets up. The rain set up by Kyogre weakens Koraidon, which makes Calyrex-I harder to remove. Calyrex-I threatens Pokemon that resist Kyogre's Water-type attacks like Rillaboom and Raging Bolt.
  • Grimmsnarl sets Light Screen and Reflect for Calyrex-I, boosting its defenses even further and making Leech Seed recovery more effective. Urshifu-R is another good partner, bypassing Protect from Pokemon that try to stall out Trick Room turns. Iron Hands and Farigiraf both pair well with Miraidon, Calyrex-I's main Restricted Pokemon partner, and work well in Calyrex-I's Trick Room.

Glass Cannon.description:
Set Details

  • Focus Sash Calyrex-S is a strong attacker and disruptor capable of swinging games around, threatening many common Pokemon such as both Calyrex formes, Amoonguss, and Koraidon.
  • Encore is great in scaring off many moves such as Fake Out from Rillaboom and Incineroar, Calm Mind from Terapagos, Protect, and much more. Disable, on the other hand, is useful to shut down powerful moves that can easily stop Calyrex-S, most notably Wide Guard from the likes of Lunala and Zamazenta-C. Nasty Plot can boost Calyrex-S's sweeping power, letting it OHKO Assault Vest Iron Hands with Psychic. Encore and Disable help Terapagos in particular, helping it to set up even in the face of threatening Fighting-types like Urshifu-R and Koraidon.
  • Focus Sash increases Calyrex-S's survivability, allowing it to survive the many attacks that can OHKO it such as Moongeist Beam from Lunala and Electro Drift from Miraidon. Calyrex-S will be able to hit hard, live an attack, and then retaliate.
  • Tera Ghost boosts the power of Astral Barrage, letting Calyrex-S always OHKO Tera Ghost Incineroar and Ursaluna while also OHKOing Lunala most of the time.

Teambuilding

  • Dark-types like Incineroar and Chi-Yu are issues for Calyrex-S, as Calyrex-S has no good way of breaking through them. Farigiraf is another struggle for Calyrex-S thanks to Farigiraf's immunity to Astral Barrage and access to Foul Play. Even with Disable, Zamazenta-C and Lunala are still bothersome for Calyrex-S, with both using Wide Guard and Lunala in particular threatening huge damage into Calyrex-S with Moongeist Beam. Urshifu-R can threaten Calyrex-S, using Tera Water or Tera Stellar to OHKO Calyrex-S with Surging Strikes.
  • Fighting-type Pokemon such as Urshifu-R and Zamazenta-C are great partners for Calyrex-S, providing good coverage into Dark-types while threatening opposing Zamazenta-C, letting Calyrex-S more freely use Astral Barrage. Calyrex-S is able to help these Fighting-type Pokemon by using Astral Barrage to break through Ghost-types like Flutter Mane.
  • Dark-type Pokemon like Chi-Yu and Incineroar are able to break down Farigiraf and Lunala with Dark Pulse and Knock Off, respectively. Chi-Yu has the added benefit of threatening Zamazenta-C thanks to Overheat. Additionally, Chi-Yu's Beads of Ruins allows Calyrex-S to OHKO bulky Calyrex-I with Tera Ghost Astral Barrage and 2HKO Zamazenta-C with Psychic or Astral Barrage. Calyrex-S, in return, can threaten Pokemon like Iron Hands and Urshifu-R, which normally scare off the aforementioned Dark-types.
  • Terapagos and Koraidon both heavily appreciate Focus Sash Calyrex-S's presence, as it threatens Fighting-types for Terapagos and helps out into Ghost-types for Koraidon. With Disable, Calyrex-S can also deny Wide Guard from the likes of Lunala, letting Terapagos freely Terastallize and use Tera Starstorm. This, in conjunction with Encore, can force the Wide Guard user to use Struggle. In return, Terapagos is able to be a reliable switch-in for Ghost-type attacks that heavily threaten Calyrex-S. Koraidon, on the other hand, is able to chunk many threats to Calyrex-S such as Lunala, Zamazenta-C, and Farigiraf, helping create openings for Calyrex-S to sweep.
  • Rillaboom is a good partner to threaten Urshifu-R while also providing Fake Out support. Rillaboom can also use U-turn to chip down Lunala and Farigiraf, notably breaking Lunala's Shadow Shield.

Setup Sweeper.description:
Set Details

  • Calyrex-S is an excellent sweeper, taking advantage of its high Speed and Special Attack coupled with a powerful spread move in Astral Barrage. Calyrex-S is often oppressive because it pressures Pokemon like Koraidon, both Calyrex formes, and Amoonguss to Terastallize to survive its STAB moves and threatens to snowball through teams if allowed to set up with Nasty Plot.
  • On more offensive compositions, such as those with Miraidon and Chi-Yu, Encore can be opted for over Nasty Plot to punish defensive archetypes with Pokemon like Calm Mind Terapagos by discouraging setup.
  • The damage boost from Life Orb is important for securing OHKOs on certain Pokemon such as Koraidon and Amoonguss with Psychic and non-Assault Vest Miraidon and Raging Bolt with Astral Barrage after a Nasty Plot.
  • The Defense investment allows Calyrex-S to survive Tera Fire Flame Charge from Koraidon in the sun and almost always survive Tera Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R. Max Speed and a Timid nature are important for at least guaranteeing a Speed tie against opposing Calyrex-S and, by extension, outrunning Chien-Pao, Miraidon, and Koraidon. The remaining EVs are put into Special Attack to maximize its damage output.
  • Tera Dark grants Calyrex-S a resistance to Dark- and Ghost-type moves, which is helpful for Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch, Lunala's Moongeist Beam, Incineroar's Knock Off, and opposing Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage.

Teambuilding

  • Many common Pokemon have Ghost- or Dark-type moves that force Calyrex-S to Terastallize, including aforementioned threats like Chien-Pao, Incineroar, and Calyrex-S, as well as others like Miraidon with Snarl and Chi-Yu with both Snarl and Dark Pulse.
  • Choice Scarf Chi-Yu is a major problem because it can outspeed and OHKO Calyrex-S with Dark Pulse or threaten significant damage with Overheat. In sun, Flutter Mane is also a threat because it outspeeds Calyrex-S and can OHKO it with Shadow Ball or Moonblast after Calyrex-S Terastallizes.
  • Farigiraf is problematic because Calyrex-S can't deal much damage to it, while Farigiraf can set up Trick Room, which Calyrex-S struggles to operate under. Grimmsnarl can wall Calyrex-S and set up Light Screen to weaken its damage output while also being able to slow Calyrex-S down with Thunder Wave. Brute Bonnet can easily tank Calyrex-S's attacks and threaten it with Sucker Punch or put it to sleep with Spore.
  • Pokemon with Wide Guard like Zamazenta-C and Lunala prevent Calyrex-S from sweeping with Astral Barrage.
  • Incineroar and Rillaboom are great partners for Calyrex-S, as they provide Fake Out utility that helps it set up. Additionally, Incineroar can reduce foes' damage output with Intimidate and Parting Shot, while Rillaboom can help Calyrex-S withstand Miraidon's attacks by overriding its Terrain.
  • Zamazenta-C is the most common Restricted Pokemon paired with this set because, with Body Press, it threatens Dark- and Normal-types that Calyrex-S struggle to hit like Terapagos, Incineroar, and Brute Bonnet. It also blocks spread moves with Wide Guard, protecting Calyrex-S against moves like Astral Barrage from opposing Calyrex-S, Glacial Lance from Calyrex-I, Heat Wave and Snarl from Chi-Yu, and Water Spout and Origin Pulse from Kyogre.
  • Miraidon is a solid Restricted partner for this set, as both it and Calyrex-S apply fast offensive pressure. Typically, with Chi-Yu on the team boosting their damage, the two special wallbreakers can immediately overwhelm teams.
  • Urshifu-R can also threaten the aforementioned Dark- and Normal-types with Close Combat and Incineroar and Chi-Yu with Surging Strikes. Choice Scarf Urshifu-R can outspeed and deal massive damage to opposing Calyrex-S. Additionally, it can break Chien-Pao's Focus Sash, allowing Calyrex-S to finish it off and receive the Grim Neigh boost.
  • Amoonguss and Ogerpon-H protect Calyrex-S by redirecting attacks with Rage Powder and Follow Me, respectively. Amoonguss can help against Trick Room teams by outspeeding Pokemon like Calyrex-I in Trick Room and putting them to sleep with Spore. Additionally, Amoonguss can redirect Thunder Wave from Grimmsnarl, which isn't as much of an issue for Amoonguss because it is naturally slow. Ogerpon-H can safely redirect Spore from Brute Bonnet and Amoonguss as well as pressure both with Ivy Cudgel.

Ursaluna.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Ursaluna mandates Trick Room support, as without it, it is very vulnerable to the vast majority of attackers, which are faster than it. Therefore, tactics that virtually guarantee that Trick Room gets set up are good for Ursaluna teams. Redirection also enables Ursaluna to throw out its powerful attacks.
  • Porygon2 is an excellent partner to Ursaluna, as it can leverage its bulk and Recover to set up Trick Room multiple times in a battle; this lets Ursaluna be a threat throughout the game. It also provides special offense to complement Ursaluna's physical offense. Incineroar is great with Porygon2, as its Fake Out makes it easier for Porygon2 to set up Trick Room, which benefits Ursaluna because it wants Trick Room to be set up. Incineroar can also safely bring in Ursaluna with Parting Shot or U-turn.
  • Ursaluna also fits on Psychic-type spam teams. These teams use Indeedee-F, which has both Follow Me and Trick Room, to enable attackers that can also set up Trick Room like Hatterene and Armarouge. Not only do these teams reliably set up Trick Room, but they also provide powerful special offense to pair with Ursaluna's powerful physical offense.
  • Gholdengo is a common sight on Ursaluna teams, as it handles Archaludon and Fighting-types that scare Ursaluna. Amoonguss fits well on Trick Room teams, as its Rage Powder lets Porygon2 set up Trick Room and Ursaluna attack more freely, and its Spore lets it shut down one foe so that the Ursaluna can target the other more freely. Amoonguss also supports Ursaluna by extending its longevity with Pollen Puff.

Strategy Comments

  • Ursaluna is a Trick Room sweeper, and it wants to be positioned on the field such that it can throw out its attacks with as many turns of Trick Room as possible. Getting Trick Room up is a major priority for Ursaluna's teams, so tactics that disrupt this, including Fake Out, Taunt, Imprison, and Trick Room, give more room to deal with the mighty bear.
  • Ursaluna is not concerned with the battle state as long as Trick Room is set; if it is, then Ursaluna provides the most value when using with Facade or Headlong Rush. However, Ursaluna itself doesn't help its partner set up Trick Room, so it is less advisable to lead Ursaluna if the opposing team has the means to disrupt Trick Room. Despite this, Ursaluna wants to enter the battle with as many turns of Trick Room as possible, so aggressive switching or switch moves can be utilized to maximize Ursaluna's threat potential.
  • Rain teams threaten to overwhelm Ursaluna with their boosted Water-type attacks, so weather of its own from the likes of Torkoal and Tyranitar is very useful; alternatively, if Trick Room is set up, Ursaluna can simply run them over itself. Grassy Glide from Rillaboom bypasses Trick Room and threatens Ursaluna greatly; Terrain support or redirection from Indeedee-F neutralizes this threat. Intimidate cycling will weaken Ursaluna greatly, but if it is behind a Substitute, it does not need to fear it. Fighting-types like Sneasler and Gallade are problematic for Ursaluna, but redirection from the likes of Amoonguss and Terastallizing Ghost can mitigate them. Corviknight completely walls Ursaluna's STAB moves, so Ursaluna is reliant on teammates to weaken Corviknight so that it can be dealt with. Certain Pokemon such as Torkoal and Hatterene move before Ursaluna in Trick Room, so they can push damage into Ursaluna before it can respond; however, these are usually only seen on opposing Trick Room teams.

Guts.description:
• Ursaluna is a destructively powerful Trick Room attacker that doesn't fear Amoonguss's Spore. It takes advantage of Guts, Flame Orb, and Facade to delete bulky foes like Garchomp, Rillaboom, and Hatterene.
  • Earthquake is a powerful spread move that threatens both foes, bypassing redirection, but it requires teammates to either be immune to Ground or use Protect in order for it to be used safely. Meanwhile, Substitute takes advantage of foes that try and use Protect to passively let Ursaluna wear itself out with burn chip damage and stall out Trick Room turns; it will also block Intimidate once it has been set up.
  • Flame Orb activates Guts and boosts the power of Facade. One side benefit of getting burned is that Ursaluna won't be put to sleep by Amoonguss's Spore and Vivillon's Sleep Powder.
  • Tera Ghost allows Ursaluna to become immune to Fighting-type attacks and Fake Out; the latter is important because it would otherwise deny Ursaluna from attacking in Trick Room. Tera Fairy also sheds Ursaluna's weakness to Fighting while letting it beat Dragon-types like Dragapult and Archaludon. Tera Normal powers up Facade even further, allowing it to turn 2HKOs or unfavorable OHKO chances on the likes of Amoonguss, Electabuzz, Clefable, Ursaluna, and Ursaluna-B into guaranteed OHKOs.
  • The given EV spread allows Ursaluna to survive a Life Orb Ursaluna-B's Blood Moon, a +1 Draco Meteor from Archaludon, or a Make it Rain from Choice Specs Gholdengo and the burn damage right after while maximizing its Attack.

Trick Room Sweeper.description:
Set Details

  • Ursaluna is one of the strongest non-Restricted physical sweepers in Regulation I, as it has an enormous Attack stat further bolstered by its ability.
