Snarl from Miraidon, Raging Bolt, and Chi-Yu and Spirit Break from Grimmsnarl can repeatedly negate Calm Mind boosts, which can slow down non-Covert Cloak Terapagos. Grimmsnarl can also use Light Screen to reduce Terapagos's damage output even further. Spore from Amoonguss and Brute Bonnet can also slow down Terapagos's progress.
  • Calm Mind Terapagos relies heavily on its teammates support to help it sweep because of Calm Mind's slow nature and Terapagos's generally low damage output without Calm Mind, and without its support Terapagos can fall behind when it comes to Speed and power.
  • Calyrex-S can use Disable to stop Fighting-type moves from Koraidon and Zamazenta-C that threaten Terapagos and Wide Guard from the likes of Zamazenta-C and Lunala, making the aforementioned checks more managable for Terapagos. It can also use Encore to lock Pokemon into moves like Fake Out, Taunt, Encore, Wide Guard, and Grimmsnarl's Light Screen or a disabled move, rendering them useless.
  • Incineroar and Rillaboom can provide Fake Out support alongside pivoting moves such as Parting Shot and U-turn; Incineroar also has Intimidate and Will-O-Wisp to weaken physical threats like Koraidon and Iron Hands, while Rillaboom sets Grassy Terrain, increasing Terapagos's longevity further.
  • Amoonguss and Ogerpon-C provide redirection in Rage Powder and Follow Me, respectively, keeping Terapagos safe. Amoonguss is an annoyance for the likes of Zamazenta-C, Urshifu-R, and Iron Hands by resisting their Fighting-type STAB moves while also taking Zamazenta-C's Heavy Slam and Behemoth Bash comfortably. Amoonguss can also heal Terapagos and restore Tera Shell with Pollen Puff. Ogerpon-C can redirect Spore from the likes of Amoonguss and Brute Bonnet, which Terapagos would normally struggle against, while threatening Urshifu-R with Power Whip.
  • Flutter Mane can use Thunder Wave to allow Terapagos to outspeed common threats such as Calyrex-S, Zamazenta-C, and Koraidon. Flutter Mane can also threaten Koraidon, Iron Hands, and both Urshifu formes with Moonblast. Taunt can prevent Wide Guard, foes' Taunt, and Encore from being used.

Power Herb.description:
Set Details

  • Power Herb Terapagos is a hyper offensive threat, firing off Meteor Beam to boost its offense and dealing unresisted damage with Tera Starstorm after Terastallizing. Terapagos has a great matchup against Miraidon and Kyogre, as it is capable of surviving attacks from them thanks to Tera Shell and then removing terrain and weather upon Terastallizing with Teraform Zero.
  • Meteor Beam OHKOs Volcarona, Ogerpon-H, and Chi-Yu and deals significant damage to Calyrex-I and Incineroar, allowing Terapagos to finish them off with Tera Starstorm on the following turn. Earth Power lets Terapagos threaten 2HKOs against Miraidon and Zamazenta-C when at +1.
  • Power Herb Terapagos sets run maximum Speed EVs with a Timid nature to outrun Adamant Urshifu sets.
  • Tera Stellar transforms Tera Starstorm into a spread Stellar-type attack and increases the damage of Meteor Beam and Earth Power, guaranteeing an OHKO on non-Assault Vest Incineroar with Meteor Beam and a 2HKO on Assault Vest Miraidon with Earth Power at +1.

Teambuilding

  • Fighting-types are generally problematic for Terapagos. Koraidon and Choice Scarf Urshifu-R outspeed Terapagos and threaten it with Collision Course and Close Combat, respectively. Zamazenta-C and Iron Hands threaten Terapagos with Body Press and Drain Punch while surviving its Earth Power.
  • Ghost-types such as Calyrex-S, Lunala, and Flutter Mane are difficult for Terapagos to damage. They pressure Terapagos to terastallize in order to sufficiently damage them with Tera Starstorm, while they can easily chip away at Terapagos with their Psychic- and Fairy-type attacks.
  • On top of their type advantages, Zamazenta-C and Lunala can disrupt Terapagos further with Wide Guard protecting them and their allies from Tera Starstorm when Terapagos has Terastallized.
  • Damage mitigation by Whimsicott and Grimmsnarl's Light Screen as well as Miraidon and Chi-Yu's Snarl severely weakens Terapagos's damage output.
  • Amoonguss can be annoying since it can comfortably withstand attacks from Terapagos, redirect its attacks, and put it to sleep with Spore.
  • Terapagos is often paired with Choice Scarf Miraidon. Miraidon deals solid damage with Electro Drift and Draco Meteor to bulky foes like Zamazenta-C and Lunala, softening them up for Terapagos to finish off with Tera Starstorm. Miraidon additionally supports Terapagos by threatening Koraidon and Urshifu-R with its STAB moves. Miraidon's Electric Terrain is also handy for preventing Amoonguss from slowing down Terapagos's offensive pressure with Spore. Miraidon's Snarl can threaten Calyrex-S and Lunala while hindering their damage output.
  • Incineroar works well with Terapagos, reducing the damage of the Fighting-type threats like the Urshifu formes and Iron Hands with Intimidate as well as threatening Ghost-types like Calyrex-S and Lunala with Knock Off, forcing them to Terastallize; afterwards,Terapagos can threaten them with Tera Starstorm.
  • Amoonguss comfortably takes Fighting-type attacks and redirects them away from Terapagos. It also disrupts these foes with Spore and can heal Terapagos with Pollen Puff, allowing it to regain Tera Shell if it hasn't Terastallized.
  • Volcarona can also be found on teams with Power Herb Terapagos, where it is often used as a setup sweeper rather than redirection support. Volcarona can resist attacks from Zamazenta-C and can threaten it with Fiery Dance alongside Amoonguss.
